# fmc_policy_lists (Data Source)

This data source reads the Policy Lists.

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "fmc_policy_lists" "example" {
  items = {
    "my_policy_lists" = {
    }
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `domain` (String) Name of the FMC domain
- `items` (Attributes Map) Map of Policy Lists. The key of the map is the name of the individual Policy List. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--items))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Id of the object

<a id="nestedatt--items"></a>
### Nested Schema for `items`

Read-Only:

- `action` (String) Select whether to allow or block access for matching conditions.
- `address_ipv4_prefix_lists` (Attributes Set) Redistribute any routes that have a destination address that is permitted by a prefix list. `address_standard_access_lists` and `address_ipv4_prefix_lists` are mutually exclusive. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--items--address_ipv4_prefix_lists))
- `address_standard_access_lists` (Attributes Set) Redistribute any routes that have a destination address that is permitted by a standard access list. `address_standard_access_lists` and `address_ipv4_prefix_lists` are mutually exclusive. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--items--address_standard_access_lists))
- `as_paths` (Attributes Set) Match a BGP autonomous system path. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--items--as_paths))
- `community_lists` (Attributes Set) Standard/Expanded Community Lists. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--items--community_lists))
- `extended_community_lists` (Attributes Set) Extended Community Lists. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--items--extended_community_lists))
- `id` (String) Id of the Policy List.
- `interface_names` (List of String) List of interface names that are not in the zones.
- `interfaces` (Attributes Set) Security zones/interface groups that contain the interfaces through which the device communicates with the management station. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--items--interfaces))
- `match_community_exactly` (Boolean) Match BGP community exactly with the specified community.
- `metric` (Number) Match routes that have a specified metric. Specyfing multiple values is not supported due to FMC API bug.
- `next_hop_ipv4_prefix_lists` (Attributes Set) Redistribute any routes that have a next hop router address passed by a prefix list. `next_hop_standard_access_lists` and `next_hop_ipv4_prefix_lists` are mutually exclusive. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--items--next_hop_ipv4_prefix_lists))
- `next_hop_standard_access_lists` (Attributes Set) Redistribute any routes that have a next hop router address passed by a standard access list. `next_hop_standard_access_lists` and `next_hop_ipv4_prefix_lists` are mutually exclusive. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--items--next_hop_standard_access_lists))
- `route_source_ipv4_prefix_lists` (Attributes Set) Redistribute routes that have been advertised by routers at the address specified by the prefix list. `route_source_standard_access_lists` and `route_source_ipv4_prefix_lists` are mutually exclusive. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--items--route_source_ipv4_prefix_lists))
- `route_source_standard_access_lists` (Attributes Set) Redistribute routes that have been advertised by routers at the address specified by the access list. `route_source_standard_access_lists` and `route_source_ipv4_prefix_lists` are mutually exclusive. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--items--route_source_standard_access_lists))
- `tag` (Number) Match routes that have a specified security group tag. Specyfing multiple values is not supported due to FMC API bug.
- `type` (String) Type of the object; this value is always 'PolicyList'.
